title: What is the performance of Redmi 6? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Redmi 6 is one of the only two Redmi phones -- Redmi 6A is another one -- in India with MediaTek processor. Powered by a MediaTek chip, Xiaomi does its software optimisation well to ensure performance is good. The Redmi 6, which comes with Helio P22 processor, is no different. It comes in two variants - the base model with 3GB of RAM and 32GB storage while the second variant comes with 3GB of RAM and 64GB storage which is expandable up to 256GB via microSD. The phone is most of the time very smooth. It shows no visible lags or stutters. Switching between apps happens in a blink of an eye, scrolling through Facebook and Twitter feeds is smooth on the Redmi 6. It is also pretty good at handling regular as well as graphics-heavy games. The Redmi 6 also works well even if you have some five or six or even 10 apps open in the background. In 8 months of use, I never found the phone slow. Run Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, YouTube, Twitter and several other apps together and the Redmi 6 still manages well. It's at times that opening of apps that it takes an extra second or two compared to a more expensive phone like the OnePlus 5, but this is never bothersome. Another good bit about the performance is that the phone doesn't heat up much even during extended gaming sessions or while watching a 3-hour long movie. Despite its low price, the Redmi 6 comes with AI-based face unlock feature and rear-mounted fingerprint sensor. Both of them work fairly quickly.

Xiaomi’s Redmi series has taken the budget smartphone segment in India by storm in the last few years, as the brand continues to launch the smartphones that offer the best value for money. The handset brings along some interesting features like a dual camera setup, an 18:9 HD+ display, and an impressive battery backup for a price of Rs 8,499. The Redmi 6 is powered by a MediaTek Helio P22 octa-core SoC built on 12nm processor and clocked at 2GHz. The powerful processor is coupled with 3GB of RAM and either 32GB or 64GB of internal storage. In terms of camera, the handset comes with dual cameras at the back – a 12-megapixel primary sensor and a 5-megapixel depth sensor. At the front, you get a 5-megapixel camera for selfies and video calling. The Redmi 6 also comes with a fingerprint sensor at the back. To keep things ticking, the handset is armed with a 3,000mAh battery. The smartphone runs Android 8.1 Oreo-based MIUI 9.6 out of the box. The battery backup offered by the Redmi 6 is quite impressive. In spite of packing a not-so-massive 3,000mAh battery, the Redmi 6 managed to last around 16 hours. As far as performance is concerned, Redmi 6 is powered with MediaTek Helio P22 processor and is capable of handling most of the daily tasks very smoothly including making calls, messaging, browsing social media, gaming, listening to songs, etc. The best thing about this handset is that it does not heat up even during long hours of gaming.
